name: cdc.current
description: Returns the current change identifier that can be used to stream changes from.
signature: cdc.current() :: (id :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: id
returnDescription.description: The change identifier.

name: cdc.earliest
description: Returns the earliest change identifier that can be used to stream changes from.
signature: cdc.earliest() :: (id :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: id
returnDescription.description: The change identifier.

name: cdc.query
description: Query changes happened from the provided change identifier.
signature: cdc.query(from =  :: STRING, selectors = [] :: LIST<MAP>) :: (id :: STRING, txId :: INTEGER, seq :: INTEGER, metadata :: MAP, event :: MAP)

argumentDescription.name: from
argumentDescription.description: The change identifier to query changes from.

argumentDescription.name: selectors
argumentDescription.description: An optional list of selectors to filter out changes.

returnDescription.name: id
returnDescription.description: The change identifier for this change event. Used to continue querying from this change event.

returnDescription.name: txId
returnDescription.description: A number identifying which transaction the change happened in, unique in combination with seq.

returnDescription.name: seq
returnDescription.description: A number used for ordering changes that happened in the same transaction.

returnDescription.name: metadata
returnDescription.description: Metadata from the transaction that caused this change event.

returnDescription.name: event
returnDescription.description: The retrieved changes on the affected entity.

name: db.awaitIndex
description: Wait for an index to come online (for example: CALL db.awaitIndex("MyIndex", 300)).
signature: db.awaitIndex(indexName :: STRING, timeOutSeconds = 300 :: INTEGER)

argumentDescription.name: indexName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the awaited index.

argumentDescription.name: timeOutSeconds
argumentDescription.description: The maximum time to wait in seconds.

name: db.awaitIndexes
description: Wait for all indexes to come online (for example: CALL db.awaitIndexes(300)).
signature: db.awaitIndexes(timeOutSeconds = 300 :: INTEGER)

argumentDescription.name: timeOutSeconds
argumentDescription.description: The maximum time to wait in seconds.

name: db.cdc.current
description: Returns the current change identifier that can be used to stream changes from.
signature: db.cdc.current() :: (id :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: id
returnDescription.description: The change identifier.

name: db.cdc.earliest
description: Returns the earliest change identifier that can be used to stream changes from.
signature: db.cdc.earliest() :: (id :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: id

name: db.cdc.query
description: Query changes happened from the provided change identifier.
signature: db.cdc.query(from =  :: STRING, selectors = [] :: LIST<MAP>) :: (id :: STRING, txId :: INTEGER, seq :: INTEGER, metadata :: MAP, event :: MAP)

argumentDescription.name: from
argumentDescription.description: The change identifier to query changes from.

argumentDescription.name: selectors
argumentDescription.description: An optional list of selectors to filter out changes.

returnDescription.name: id
returnDescription.description: The change identifier for this change event. Used to continue querying from this change event.

returnDescription.name: txId
returnDescription.description: A number identifying which transaction the change happened in, unique in combination with seq.

returnDescription.name: seq
returnDescription.description: A number used for ordering changes that happened in the same transaction.

returnDescription.name: metadata
returnDescription.description: Metadata from the transaction that caused this change event.

returnDescription.name: event
returnDescription.description: The retrieved changes on the affected entity.

name: db.checkpoint
description: Initiate and wait for a new check point, or wait any already on-going check point to complete. Note that this temporarily disables the `db.checkpoint.iops.limit` setting in order to make the check point complete faster. This might cause transaction throughput to degrade slightly, due to increased IO load.
signature: db.checkpoint() :: (success :: BOOLEAN, message :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: success
returnDescription.description: Whether the checkpoint has successfully completed.

returnDescription.name: message
returnDescription.description: Details about the outcome of the procedure.

name: db.clearQueryCaches
description: Clears all query caches.
signature: db.clearQueryCaches() :: (value :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: Information about the number of cleared query caches.

name: db.create.setNodeVectorProperty
description: Set a vector property on a given node in a more space efficient representation than Cypher's SET.
signature: db.create.setNodeVectorProperty(node :: NODE, key :: STRING, vector :: ANY)

argumentDescription.name: node
argumentDescription.description: The node on which the new property will be stored.

argumentDescription.name: key
argumentDescription.description: The name of the new property.

argumentDescription.name: vector
argumentDescription.description: The object containing the embedding.

name: db.create.setRelationshipVectorProperty
description: Set a vector property on a given relationship in a more space efficient representation than Cypher's SET.
signature: db.create.setRelationshipVectorProperty(relationship :: RELATIONSHIP, key :: STRING, vector :: ANY)

argumentDescription.name: relationship
argumentDescription.description: The relationship on which the new property will be stored.

argumentDescription.name: key
argumentDescription.description: The name of the new property.

argumentDescription.name: vector
argumentDescription.description: The object containing the embedding.

name: db.create.setVectorProperty
description: Set a vector property on a given node in a more space efficient representation than Cypher's SET.
signature: db.create.setVectorProperty(node :: NODE, key :: STRING, vector :: ANY) :: (node :: NODE)

argumentDescription.name: node
argumentDescription.description: The node on which the new property will be stored.

argumentDescription.name: key
argumentDescription.description: The name of the new property.

argumentDescription.name: vector
argumentDescription.description: The object containing the embedding.

returnDescription.name: node
returnDescription.description: The node on which the vector property was set.

name: db.createLabel
description: Create a label
signature: db.createLabel(newLabel :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: newLabel
argumentDescription.description: Label name.

name: db.createProperty
description: Create a Property
signature: db.createProperty(newProperty :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: newProperty
argumentDescription.description: Property name.

name: db.createRelationshipType
description: Create a RelationshipType
signature: db.createRelationshipType(newRelationshipType :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: newRelationshipType
argumentDescription.description: Relationship type name.

name: db.index.fulltext.awaitEventuallyConsistentIndexRefresh
description: Wait for the updates from recently committed transactions to be applied to any eventually-consistent full-text indexes.
signature: db.index.fulltext.awaitEventuallyConsistentIndexRefresh()

name: db.index.fulltext.listAvailableAnalyzers
description: List the available analyzers that the full-text indexes can be configured with.
signature: db.index.fulltext.listAvailableAnalyzers() :: (analyzer :: STRING, description :: STRING, stopwords :: LIST<STRING>)

returnDescription.name: analyzer
returnDescription.description: The name of the analyzer.

returnDescription.name: description
returnDescription.description: The  description of the analyzer.

returnDescription.name: stopwords
returnDescription.description: The stopwords used by the analyzer to tokenize strings.

name: db.index.fulltext.queryNodes
description:
Query the given full-text index. Returns the matching nodes and their Lucene query score, ordered by score.
Valid _key: value_ pairs for the `options` map are:

* 'skip' -- to skip the top N results.
* 'limit' -- to limit the number of results returned.
* 'analyzer' -- to use the specified analyzer as a search analyzer for this query.

The `options` map and any of the keys are optional.
An example of the `options` map: `{skip: 30, limit: 10, analyzer: 'whitespace'}`
signature: db.index.fulltext.queryNodes(indexName :: STRING, queryString :: STRING, options = {} :: MAP) :: (node :: NODE, score :: FLOAT)

argumentDescription.name: indexName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the full-text index.

argumentDescription.name: queryString
argumentDescription.description: The string to find approximate matches for.

argumentDescription.name: options
argumentDescription.description: {skip :: INTEGER, limit :: INTEGER, analyzer :: STRING}

returnDescription.name: node
returnDescription.description: A node which contains a property similar to the query string.

returnDescription.name: score
returnDescription.description: The score measuring how similar the node property is to the query string.

name: db.index.fulltext.queryRelationships
description:
Query the given full-text index. Returns the matching relationships and their Lucene query score, ordered by score.
Valid _key: value_ pairs for the `options` map are:

* 'skip' -- to skip the top N results.
* 'limit' -- to limit the number of results returned.
* 'analyzer' -- to use the specified analyzer as a search analyzer for this query.

The `options` map and any of the keys are optional.
An example of the `options` map: `{skip: 30, limit: 10, analyzer: 'whitespace'}`
signature: db.index.fulltext.queryRelationships(indexName :: STRING, queryString :: STRING, options = {} :: MAP) :: (relationship :: RELATIONSHIP, score :: FLOAT)

argumentDescription.name: indexName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the full-text index.

argumentDescription.name: queryString
argumentDescription.description: The string to find approximate matches for.

argumentDescription.name: options
argumentDescription.description: {skip :: INTEGER, limit :: INTEGER, analyzer :: STRING}

returnDescription.name: relationship
returnDescription.description: A relationship which contains a property similar to the query string.

returnDescription.name: score
returnDescription.description: The score measuring how similar the relationship property is to the query string.

name: db.index.vector.createNodeIndex
description:
Create a named node vector index for the specified label and property with the given vector dimensionality using either the EUCLIDEAN or COSINE similarity function.
Both similarity functions are case-insensitive.
Use the `db.index.vector.queryNodes` procedure to query the named index.
signature: db.index.vector.createNodeIndex(indexName :: STRING, label :: STRING, propertyKey :: STRING, vectorDimension :: INTEGER, vectorSimilarityFunction :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: indexName
argumentDescription.description: indexName :: STRING

argumentDescription.name: label
argumentDescription.description: label :: STRING

argumentDescription.name: propertyKey
argumentDescription.description: propertyKey :: STRING

argumentDescription.name: vectorDimension
argumentDescription.description: vectorDimension :: INTEGER

argumentDescription.name: vectorSimilarityFunction
argumentDescription.description: vectorSimilarityFunction :: STRING

name: db.index.vector.queryNodes
description:
Query the given node vector index.
Returns requested number of nearest neighbors to the provided query vector,
and their similarity score to that query vector, based on the configured similarity function for the index.
The similarity score is a value between [0, 1]; where 0 indicates least similar, 1 most similar.
signature: db.index.vector.queryNodes(indexName :: STRING, numberOfNearestNeighbours :: INTEGER, query :: ANY) :: (node :: NODE, score :: FLOAT)

argumentDescription.name: indexName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the vector index.

argumentDescription.name: numberOfNearestNeighbours
argumentDescription.description: The size of the vector neighbourhood.

argumentDescription.name: query
argumentDescription.description: The object to find approximate matches for.

returnDescription.name: node
returnDescription.description: A node which contains a vector property similar to the query object.

returnDescription.name: score
returnDescription.description: The score measuring how similar the node property is to the query object.

name: db.index.vector.queryRelationships
description:
Query the given relationship vector index.
Returns requested number of nearest neighbors to the provided query vector,
and their similarity score to that query vector, based on the configured similarity function for the index.
The similarity score is a value between [0, 1]; where 0 indicates least similar, 1 most similar.
signature: db.index.vector.queryRelationships(indexName :: STRING, numberOfNearestNeighbours :: INTEGER, query :: ANY) :: (relationship :: RELATIONSHIP, score :: FLOAT)

argumentDescription.name: indexName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the vector index.

argumentDescription.name: numberOfNearestNeighbours
argumentDescription.description: The size of the vector neighbourhood.

argumentDescription.name: query
argumentDescription.description: The object to find approximate matches for.

returnDescription.name: relationship
returnDescription.description: A relationship which contains a vector property similar to the query object.

returnDescription.name: score
returnDescription.description: The score measuring how similar the relationship property is to the query object.

name: db.info
description: Provides information regarding the database.
signature: db.info() :: (id :: STRING, name :: STRING, creationDate :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: id
returnDescription.description: The id of the database.

returnDescription.name: name
returnDescription.description: The name of the database.

returnDescription.name: creationDate
returnDescription.description: The creation date of the database, formatted according to the ISO-8601 Standard.

name: db.labels
description: List all labels attached to nodes within a database according to the user's access rights. The procedure returns empty results if the user is not authorized to view those labels.
signature: db.labels() :: (label :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: label
returnDescription.description: A label within the database.

name: db.listLocks
description: List all locks at this database.
signature: db.listLocks() :: (mode :: STRING, resourceType :: STRING, resourceId :: INTEGER, transactionId :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: mode
returnDescription.description: The locking mode this lock is using, either "SHARED" or "EXCLUSIVE".

returnDescription.name: resourceType
returnDescription.description: The type of resource (e.g. nodes, relationships, labels) this lock protects.

returnDescription.name: resourceId
returnDescription.description: The id of the resource this lock protects.

returnDescription.name: transactionId
returnDescription.description: The id of the transaction that owns this lock.

name: db.ping
description: This procedure can be used by client side tooling to test whether they are correctly connected to a database. The procedure is available in all databases and always returns true. A faulty connection can be detected by not being able to call this procedure.
signature: db.ping() :: (success :: BOOLEAN)

returnDescription.name: success
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the connection call to the database has been successful.

name: db.prepareForReplanning
description: Triggers an index resample and waits for it to complete, and after that clears query caches. After this procedure has finished queries will be planned using the latest database statistics.
signature: db.prepareForReplanning(timeOutSeconds = 300 :: INTEGER)

argumentDescription.name: timeOutSeconds
argumentDescription.description: The maximum time to wait in seconds.

name: db.propertyKeys
description: List all property keys in the database.
signature: db.propertyKeys() :: (propertyKey :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: propertyKey
returnDescription.description: A property key in the database.

name: db.relationshipTypes
description: List all types attached to relationships within a database according to the user's access rights. The procedure returns empty results if the user is not authorized to view those relationship types.
signature: db.relationshipTypes() :: (relationshipType :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: relationshipType
returnDescription.description: A relationship type in the database.

name: db.resampleIndex
description: Schedule resampling of an index (for example: CALL db.resampleIndex("MyIndex")).
signature: db.resampleIndex(indexName :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: indexName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the index.

name: db.resampleOutdatedIndexes
description: Schedule resampling of all outdated indexes.
signature: db.resampleOutdatedIndexes()

name: db.schema.nodeTypeProperties
description: Show the derived property schema of the nodes in tabular form.
signature: db.schema.nodeTypeProperties() :: (nodeType :: STRING, nodeLabels :: LIST<STRING>, propertyName :: STRING, propertyTypes :: LIST<STRING>, mandatory :: BOOLEAN)

returnDescription.name: nodeType
returnDescription.description: A name generated from the labels on the node.

returnDescription.name: nodeLabels
returnDescription.description: A list containing the labels on a category of node.

returnDescription.name: propertyName
returnDescription.description: A property key on a category of node.

returnDescription.name: propertyTypes
returnDescription.description: All types of a property belonging to a node category.

returnDescription.name: mandatory
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the property is present on all nodes belonging to a node category.

name: db.schema.relTypeProperties
description: Show the derived property schema of the relationships in tabular form.
signature: db.schema.relTypeProperties() :: (relType :: STRING, propertyName :: STRING, propertyTypes :: LIST<STRING>, mandatory :: BOOLEAN)

returnDescription.name: relType
returnDescription.description: A name generated from the type on the relationship.

returnDescription.name: propertyName
returnDescription.description: A property key on a category of relationship.

returnDescription.name: propertyTypes
returnDescription.description: All types of a property belonging to a relationship category.

returnDescription.name: mandatory
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the property is present on all relationships belonging to a relationship category.

name: db.schema.visualization
description: Visualizes the schema of the data based on available statistics. A new node is returned for each label. The properties represented on the node include: `name` (label name), `indexes` (list of indexes), and `constraints` (list of constraints). A relationship of a given type is returned for all possible combinations of start and end nodes. The properties represented on the relationship include: `name` (type name). Note that this may include additional relationships that do not exist in the data due to the information available in the count store.
signature: db.schema.visualization() :: (nodes :: LIST<NODE>, relationships :: LIST<RELATIONSHIP>)

returnDescription.name: nodes
returnDescription.description: A list of virtual nodes representing each label in the database.

returnDescription.name: relationships
returnDescription.description: A list of virtual relationships representing all combinations between start and end nodes in the database.

name: db.stats.clear
description: Clear collected data of a given data section. Valid sections are 'QUERIES'
signature: db.stats.clear(section :: STRING) :: (section :: STRING, success :: BOOLEAN, message :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: section
argumentDescription.description: The section to clear. The only available section is: 'QUERIES'.

returnDescription.name: section
returnDescription.description: The section cleared.

returnDescription.name: success
returnDescription.description: Whether the section was successfully cleared.

returnDescription.name: message
returnDescription.description: Details about the outcome of the procedure.

name: db.stats.collect
description: Start data collection of a given data section. Valid sections are 'QUERIES'
signature: db.stats.collect(section :: STRING, config = {} :: MAP) :: (section :: STRING, success :: BOOLEAN, message :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: section
argumentDescription.description: The section to collect. The only available section is: 'QUERIES'.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: {durationSeconds = -1 :: INTEGER}

returnDescription.name: section
returnDescription.description: The section collected.

returnDescription.name: success
returnDescription.description: Whether the section was successfully collected.

returnDescription.name: message
returnDescription.description: Details about the outcome of the procedure.

name: db.stats.retrieve
description: Retrieve statistical data about the current database. Valid sections are 'GRAPH COUNTS', 'TOKENS', 'QUERIES', 'META'
signature: db.stats.retrieve(section :: STRING, config = {} :: MAP) :: (section :: STRING, data :: MAP)

argumentDescription.name: section
argumentDescription.description: A section of stats to retrieve: ('GRAPH COUNTS', 'TOKENS', 'QUERIES', 'META').

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: {maxInvocations = 100 :: INTEGER}

returnDescription.name: section
returnDescription.description: The section retrieved.

returnDescription.name: data
returnDescription.description: Data pertaining to the retrieved statistics.

name: db.stats.retrieveAllAnonymized
description: Retrieve all available statistical data about the current database, in an anonymized form.
signature: db.stats.retrieveAllAnonymized(graphToken :: STRING, config = {} :: MAP) :: (section :: STRING, data :: MAP)

argumentDescription.name: graphToken
argumentDescription.description: The name of the graph token.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description: {maxInvocations = 100 :: INTEGER}

returnDescription.name: section
returnDescription.description: The section retrieved.

returnDescription.name: data
returnDescription.description: Data pertaining to the retrieved statistics.

name: db.stats.status
description: Retrieve the status of all available collector daemons, for this database.
signature: db.stats.status() :: (section :: STRING, status :: STRING, data :: MAP)

returnDescription.name: section
returnDescription.description: String with the message "QUERIES".

returnDescription.name: status
returnDescription.description: The status of the QueryCollector: "idle" or "collecting".

returnDescription.name: data
returnDescription.description: data :: MAP

name: db.stats.stop
description: Stop data collection of a given data section. Valid sections are 'QUERIES'
signature: db.stats.stop(section :: STRING) :: (section :: STRING, success :: BOOLEAN, message :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: section
argumentDescription.description: The section to stop. The only available section is: 'QUERIES'.

returnDescription.name: section
returnDescription.description: The stopped section.

returnDescription.name: success
returnDescription.description: Whether the section was successfully stopped.

returnDescription.name: message
returnDescription.description: Details about the outcome of the procedure.

name: dbms.checkConfigValue
description: Check if a potential config setting value is valid.
signature: dbms.checkConfigValue(setting :: STRING, value :: STRING) :: (valid :: BOOLEAN, message :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: setting
argumentDescription.description: The name of the setting.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The setting value to verify.

returnDescription.name: valid
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the setting value is valid.

returnDescription.name: message
returnDescription.description: Details about the outcome of the procedure.

name: dbms.cluster.checkConnectivity
signature: dbms.cluster.checkConnectivity(port-name = null :: STRING, server = null :: STRING) :: (serverId :: STRING, name :: STRING, address :: STRING, mode-constraint :: STRING, port-name :: STRING, port-address :: STRING, result :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: serverId
returnDescription.description: The id of the checked server.

returnDescription.name: name
returnDescription.description: name :: STRING

returnDescription.name: address
returnDescription.description: address :: STRING

returnDescription.name: mode-constraint
returnDescription.description: The instance mode constraint of the server.

returnDescription.name: port-name
returnDescription.description: The name of the checked port.

returnDescription.name: port-address
returnDescription.description: The address of the checked port.

returnDescription.name: result
returnDescription.description: Whether the check was successful or not.

description: Check the connectivity of this instance to other cluster members. Not all ports are relevant to all members. Valid values for 'port-name' are: []

argumentDescription.name: port-name
argumentDescription.description: The name of the port: ('CLUSTER', 'RAFT').

argumentDescription.name: server
argumentDescription.description: The id of the server to check connectivity of.

name: dbms.cluster.cordonServer
signature: dbms.cluster.cordonServer(server :: STRING)
description: Mark a server in the topology as not suitable for new allocations. It will not force current allocations off the server. This is useful when deallocating databases when you have multiple unavailable servers.

argumentDescription.name: server
argumentDescription.description: The name or id of the server to be cordoned.

name: dbms.cluster.protocols
description: Overview of installed protocols
signature: dbms.cluster.protocols() :: (orientation :: STRING, remoteAddress :: STRING, applicationProtocol :: STRING, applicationProtocolVersion :: INTEGER, modifierProtocols :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: orientation
returnDescription.description: Direction of the protocol (inbound or outbound).

returnDescription.name: remoteAddress
returnDescription.description: The socket address this protocol is available on.

returnDescription.name: applicationProtocol
returnDescription.description: The name of the protocol.

returnDescription.name: applicationProtocolVersion
returnDescription.description: The version of the protocol.

returnDescription.name: modifierProtocols
returnDescription.description: Installed modifier protocols, for example, compression.

name: dbms.cluster.readReplicaToggle
signature: dbms.cluster.readReplicaToggle(databaseName :: STRING, pause :: BOOLEAN) :: (state :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: state
returnDescription.description: The current state of the secondary replication process.

description: The toggle can pause or resume read replica (deprecated in favor of dbms.cluster.secondaryReplicationDisable)

argumentDescription.name: databaseName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the database to toggle the secondary replication process for.

argumentDescription.name: pause
argumentDescription.description: Whether or not to enable/disable the secondary replication process.

name: dbms.cluster.routing.getRoutingTable
description: Returns the advertised bolt capable endpoints for a given database, divided by each endpoint's capabilities. For example, an endpoint may serve read queries, write queries, and/or future `getRoutingTable` requests.
signature: dbms.cluster.routing.getRoutingTable(context :: MAP, database = null :: STRING) :: (ttl :: INTEGER, servers :: LIST<MAP>)

argumentDescription.name: context
argumentDescription.description: Routing context, for example, routing policies.

argumentDescription.name: database
argumentDescription.description: The database to get a routing table for.

returnDescription.name: ttl
returnDescription.description: Time to live (in seconds) for the routing table.

returnDescription.name: servers
returnDescription.description: Servers grouped by whether they are readers, writers, or routers.

name: dbms.cluster.secondaryReplicationDisable
signature: dbms.cluster.secondaryReplicationDisable(databaseName :: STRING, pause :: BOOLEAN) :: (state :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: state
returnDescription.description: The current state of the secondary replication process.

description: The toggle can pause or resume the secondary replication process.

argumentDescription.name: databaseName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the database to toggle the secondary replication process for.

argumentDescription.name: pause
argumentDescription.description: Whether or not to enable/disable the secondary replication process.

name: dbms.cluster.deallocateDatabaseFromServer

returnDescription.description: The id of the server.

name: dbms.components
description: List DBMS components and their versions.
signature: dbms.components() :: (name :: STRING, versions :: LIST<STRING>, edition :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: name
returnDescription.description: The name of the component.

returnDescription.name: versions
returnDescription.description: The installed versions of the component.

returnDescription.name: edition
returnDescription.description: The Neo4j edition of the DBMS.

name: dbms.info
description: Provides information regarding the DBMS.
signature: dbms.info() :: (id :: STRING, name :: STRING, creationDate :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: id
returnDescription.description: The id of the DBMS.

returnDescription.name: name
returnDescription.description: The name of the DBMS.

returnDescription.name: creationDate
returnDescription.description: The creation date of the DBMS.

name: dbms.killConnection
description: Kill network connection with the given connection id.
signature: dbms.killConnection(id :: STRING) :: (connectionId :: STRING, username :: STRING, message :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: id
argumentDescription.description: The id of the connection to kill.

returnDescription.name: connectionId
returnDescription.description: The id of the connection killed.

returnDescription.name: username
returnDescription.description: The username of the user of the killed connection.

returnDescription.name: message
returnDescription.description: Details about the outcome of the procedure.

name: dbms.killConnections
description: Kill all network connections with the given connection ids.
signature: dbms.killConnections(ids :: LIST<STRING>) :: (connectionId :: STRING, username :: STRING, message :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: ids
argumentDescription.description: The ids of the connections to kill.

returnDescription.name: connectionId
returnDescription.description: The id of the connection killed.

returnDescription.name: username
returnDescription.description: The username of the user of the killed connection.

returnDescription.name: message
returnDescription.description: Details about the outcome of the procedure.

name: dbms.listActiveLocks
description: List the active lock requests granted for the transaction executing the query with the given query id.
signature: dbms.listActiveLocks(queryId :: STRING) :: (mode :: STRING, resourceType :: STRING, resourceId :: INTEGER)

argumentDescription.name: queryId
argumentDescription.description: The id of the query to check for active locks on.

returnDescription.name: mode
returnDescription.description: The lock type: ('SHARED', 'EXCLUSIVE').

returnDescription.name: resourceType
returnDescription.description: The locked resource.

returnDescription.name: resourceId
returnDescription.description: The id of the locked resource.

name: dbms.listCapabilities
description: List capabilities.
signature: dbms.listCapabilities() :: (name :: STRING, description :: STRING, value :: ANY)

returnDescription.name: name
returnDescription.description: The full name of the capability (e.g. "dbms.instance.version").

returnDescription.name: description
returnDescription.description: The capability description (e.g. "Neo4j version this instance is running").

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The capability object if it is present in the system (e.g. "5.20.0").

name: dbms.listConfig
description: List the currently active configuration settings of Neo4j.
signature: dbms.listConfig(searchString =  :: STRING) :: (name :: STRING, description :: STRING, value :: STRING, dynamic :: BOOLEAN, defaultValue :: STRING, startupValue :: STRING, explicitlySet :: BOOLEAN, validValues :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: searchString
argumentDescription.description: A string that filters on the name of config settings.

returnDescription.name: name
returnDescription.description: The name of the setting.

returnDescription.name: description
returnDescription.description: The description of the setting.

returnDescription.name: value
returnDescription.description: The set value of the setting.

returnDescription.name: dynamic
returnDescription.description: If the setting can be set dynamically or not.

returnDescription.name: defaultValue
returnDescription.description: The default value of the setting.

returnDescription.name: startupValue
returnDescription.description: The value of the setting when the database started.

returnDescription.name: explicitlySet
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the setting was explicitly set.

returnDescription.name: validValues
returnDescription.description: A description of the valid values.

name: dbms.listConnections
description: List all accepted network connections at this instance that are visible to the user.
signature: dbms.listConnections() :: (connectionId :: STRING, connectTime :: STRING, connector :: STRING, username :: STRING, userAgent :: STRING, serverAddress :: STRING, clientAddress :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: connectionId
returnDescription.description: The id of the connection.

returnDescription.name: connectTime
returnDescription.description: The time the connection was established, formatted according to the ISO-8601 Standard.

returnDescription.name: connector
returnDescription.description: The protocol of the connector.

returnDescription.name: username
returnDescription.description: The username of the connected user.

returnDescription.name: userAgent
returnDescription.description: The active agent.

returnDescription.name: serverAddress
returnDescription.description: The address of the connected server.

returnDescription.name: clientAddress
returnDescription.description: The address of the connected client.

name: dbms.listPools
description: List all memory pools, including sub pools, currently registered at this instance that are visible to the user.
signature: dbms.listPools() :: (pool :: STRING, databaseName :: STRING, heapMemoryUsed :: STRING, heapMemoryUsedBytes :: STRING, nativeMemoryUsed :: STRING, nativeMemoryUsedBytes :: STRING, freeMemory :: STRING, freeMemoryBytes :: STRING, totalPoolMemory :: STRING, totalPoolMemoryBytes :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: pool
returnDescription.description: The name of the memory pool.

returnDescription.name: databaseName
returnDescription.description: The name of the database.

returnDescription.name: heapMemoryUsed
returnDescription.description: The amount of heap memory used.

returnDescription.name: heapMemoryUsedBytes
returnDescription.description: The amount of heap memory used in bytes.

returnDescription.name: nativeMemoryUsed
returnDescription.description: The amount of native memory used.

returnDescription.name: nativeMemoryUsedBytes
returnDescription.description: The amount of native memory used in bytes.

returnDescription.name: freeMemory
returnDescription.description: The amount of free memory.

returnDescription.name: freeMemoryBytes
returnDescription.description: The amount of free memory in bytes.

returnDescription.name: totalPoolMemory
returnDescription.description: The total pool memory.

returnDescription.name: totalPoolMemoryBytes
returnDescription.description: The total pool memory in bytes.

name: dbms.quarantineDatabase
description: Place a database into quarantine or remove it from it.
signature: dbms.quarantineDatabase(databaseName :: STRING, setStatus :: BOOLEAN, reason = No reason given :: STRING, wipeMode = DO_NOT_WIPE :: STRING) :: (databaseName :: STRING, quarantined :: BOOLEAN, result :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: databaseName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the database to set the quarantine status of.

argumentDescription.name: setStatus
argumentDescription.description: Whether or not to quarantine the database.

argumentDescription.name: reason
argumentDescription.description: The reason to quarantine the database.

argumentDescription.name: wipeMode
argumentDescription.description: Optional wiping action to apply while lifting the quarantine.

returnDescription.name: databaseName
returnDescription.description: The name of the database.

returnDescription.name: quarantined
returnDescription.description: Whether or not the database is quarantined.

returnDescription.name: result
returnDescription.description: Details about the outcome of the procedure.

name: dbms.queryJmx
description: Query JMX management data by domain and name. For instance, use `*:*` to find all JMX beans.
signature: dbms.queryJmx(query :: STRING) :: (name :: STRING, description :: STRING, attributes :: MAP)

argumentDescription.name: query
argumentDescription.description: A query for MBeans on this MBeanServer (e.g. '*:*,name=*neo4j*' for all metrics in neo4j database).

returnDescription.name: name
returnDescription.description: The name of the metric.

returnDescription.name: description
returnDescription.description: The description of the metric.

returnDescription.name: attributes
returnDescription.description: A collection with the attributes (values) of that metric.

name: dbms.routing.getRoutingTable
description: Returns the advertised bolt capable endpoints for a given database, divided by each endpoint's capabilities. For example, an endpoint may serve read queries, write queries, and/or future `getRoutingTable` requests.
signature: dbms.routing.getRoutingTable(context :: MAP, database = null :: STRING) :: (ttl :: INTEGER, servers :: LIST<MAP>)

argumentDescription.name: context
argumentDescription.description: Routing context, for example, routing policies.

argumentDescription.name: database
argumentDescription.description: The database to get a routing table for.

returnDescription.name: ttl
returnDescription.description: Time to live (in seconds) for the routing table.

returnDescription.name: servers
returnDescription.description: Servers grouped by whether they are readers, writers, or routers.

name: dbms.scheduler.failedJobs
description: List failed job runs. There is a limit for amount of historical data.
signature: dbms.scheduler.failedJobs() :: (jobId :: STRING, group :: STRING, database :: STRING, submitter :: STRING, description :: STRING, type :: STRING, submitted :: STRING, executionStart :: STRING, failureTime :: STRING, failureDescription :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: jobId
returnDescription.description: The id of the failed job.

returnDescription.name: group
returnDescription.description: The category of the failed job.

returnDescription.name: database
returnDescription.description: The name of the database the job failed in.

returnDescription.name: submitter
returnDescription.description: The creator of the failed job.

returnDescription.name: description
returnDescription.description: Information about the failed job.

returnDescription.name: type
returnDescription.description: The interval of the failed job.

returnDescription.name: submitted
returnDescription.description: The submission time of the failed job.

returnDescription.name: executionStart
returnDescription.description: The start time of the failed job.

returnDescription.name: failureTime
returnDescription.description: The failure time of the failed job.

returnDescription.name: failureDescription
returnDescription.description: Information about the job failure.

name: dbms.scheduler.groups
description: List the job groups that are active in the database internal job scheduler.
signature: dbms.scheduler.groups() :: (group :: STRING, threads :: INTEGER)

returnDescription.name: group
returnDescription.description: The name of the job group.

returnDescription.name: threads
returnDescription.description: The number of active threads in that job group.

name: dbms.scheduler.jobs
description: List all jobs that are active in the database internal job scheduler.
signature: dbms.scheduler.jobs() :: (jobId :: STRING, group :: STRING, submitted :: STRING, database :: STRING, submitter :: STRING, description :: STRING, type :: STRING, scheduledAt :: STRING, period :: STRING, state :: STRING, currentStateDescription :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: jobId
returnDescription.description: The id of the job.

returnDescription.name: group
returnDescription.description: The category of the job.

returnDescription.name: submitted
returnDescription.description: The submission time of the job.

returnDescription.name: database
returnDescription.description: The name of the database the job is in.

returnDescription.name: submitter
returnDescription.description: The creator of the job.

returnDescription.name: description
returnDescription.description: Information about the job.

returnDescription.name: type
returnDescription.description: The interval of the job.

returnDescription.name: scheduledAt
returnDescription.description: The start time of the job.

returnDescription.name: period
returnDescription.description: The interval for jobs run periodically.

returnDescription.name: state
returnDescription.description: The state of the job: ('EXECUTING', 'SCHEDULED').

returnDescription.name: currentStateDescription
returnDescription.description: A description of the job state.

name: dbms.security.clearAuthCache
description: Clears authentication and authorization cache.
signature: dbms.security.clearAuthCache()

name: dbms.setConfigValue
description: Update a given setting value. Passing an empty value results in removing the configured value and falling back to the default value. Changes do not persist and are lost if the server is restarted. In a clustered environment, `dbms.setConfigValue` affects only the cluster member it is run against.
signature: dbms.setConfigValue(setting :: STRING, value :: STRING)

argumentDescription.name: setting
argumentDescription.description: The name of the setting.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value to set.

name: dbms.setDatabaseAllocator
signature: dbms.setDatabaseAllocator(allocator :: STRING)
description: With this method you can set the allocator that is responsible for selecting servers for hosting databases.

argumentDescription.name: allocator
argumentDescription.description: The name of the allocator.

name: dbms.setDefaultAllocationNumbers
signature: dbms.setDefaultAllocationNumbers(primaries :: INTEGER, secondaries :: INTEGER)
description: With this method you can set the default number of primaries and secondaries.

argumentDescription.name: primaries
argumentDescription.description: The default number of primaries.

argumentDescription.name: secondaries
argumentDescription.description: The default number of secondaries.

name: dbms.setDefaultDatabase
signature: dbms.setDefaultDatabase(databaseName :: STRING) :: (result :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: result
returnDescription.description: Information about the default database.

description: Change the default database to the provided value. The database must exist and the old default database must be stopped.

argumentDescription.name: databaseName
argumentDescription.description: The name of the database.

name: dbms.cluster.recreateDatabase
signature: dbms.cluster.recreateDatabase(database :: STRING, options = {} :: MAP)
description: Recreates a database while keeping all RBAC settings. The procedure initiates a process, which when complete, will have synchronized and started all database instances within the cluster.

argumentDescription.name: database
argumentDescription.description: database :: STRING

argumentDescription.name: options
argumentDescription.description: options = {} :: MAP

name: dbms.showCurrentUser

returnDescription.description: The name of the current user.

returnDescription.name: roles

returnDescription.name: flags

name: dbms.showTopologyGraphConfig

returnDescription.name: defaultPrimariesCount
returnDescription.description: The default number of primaries.

returnDescription.name: defaultSecondariesCount
returnDescription.description: The default number of secondaries.

description: With this method the configuration of the Topology Graph can be displayed.

name: dbms.upgrade
description: Upgrade the system database schema if it is not the current schema.
signature: dbms.upgrade() :: (status :: STRING, upgradeResult :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: status
returnDescription.description: The upgrade status of the system database.

returnDescription.name: upgradeResult
returnDescription.description: Information about the upgrade outcome.

name: dbms.upgradeStatus
description: Report the current status of the system database sub-graph schema.
signature: dbms.upgradeStatus() :: (status :: STRING, description :: STRING, resolution :: STRING)

returnDescription.name: status
returnDescription.description: The upgrade status of the system database.

returnDescription.name: description
returnDescription.description: Information describing the upgrade status.

returnDescription.name: resolution
returnDescription.description: Information about the steps necessary to upgrade.

name: tx.getMetaData
description: Provides attached transaction metadata.
signature: tx.getMetaData() :: (metadata :: MAP)

returnDescription.name: metadata
returnDescription.description: Metadata about the transaction.

name: tx.setMetaData
description: Attaches a map of data to the transaction. The data will be printed when listing queries, and inserted into the query log.
signature: tx.setMetaData(data :: MAP)

argumentDescription.name: data
argumentDescription.description: Metadata to attach to the transaction.
